section.title: EVMAddLifecycleEvent
section.para: EVMAddLifecycleEvent (event, status, message, guid, location, created_by) adds a lifecycle event record for a virtual machine and records the event, status, message, and created_by values in the lifecycle_events table in the VMDB. The method looks up a virtual machine either by GUID or fully-qualified path to the configuration file. (For VMware, a fully-qualified path would be similar to [datastore-1] test3/test3.vmx)

formalpara.title: Examples
formalpara.para: The following examples demonstrate EVMAddLifecycleEvent usage:

example.title: EVMAddLifecycleEvent WSDL
example.programlisting: <message name="EVMAddLifecycleEvent"> <part name="event" type="xsd:string"/> <part name="status" type="xsd:string"/> <part name="message" type="xsd:string"/> <part name="vmGuid" type="xsd:string"/> <part name="vmLocation" type="xsd:string"/> <part name="createdBy" type="xsd:string"/> </message> <message name="EVMAddLifecycleEventResponse"> <part name="return" type="xsd:boolean"/> </message>
